actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to require that all covered workers be informed annually of their potential benefit rights (based on their then current wage records), and that new primary and survivor beneficiaries be furnished with information concerning the total amount of the social security taxes paid toward their benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Requires that all workers covered under the old-age, survivors, and disability insurance program of the Social Security Act be informed annually of their potential benefit rights (based on their then current wage records), and that new primary and survivor beneficiaries be furnished with information concerning the total amount of the social security taxes paid toward their benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to require that all covered workers be informed annually of their potential benefit rights (based on their then current wage records), and that new primary and survivor beneficiaries be furnished with information concerning the total amount of the social security taxes paid toward their benefits.
